Thanks for the kind words fellas.

I'm planning on re-visiting Office sysprepped versions perhaps for win7 and win8, but they are not something I want to do every month. A lot of people have problems using them for some reason, so I try not to use sysprep too much. That being said, for the people that can use them, they are WAY faster than the normal installs.  I think they are worth at least a once every 3 months or so treatment.

Those same people seem to request having DaRT8 on them, so I'll see if I cannot include that in the boot options.

I forgot to mention in the description, but since this is meant for IT pros I took out the autorun and the autorun setup. I left the actual setup in the sources/ folder, but I didn't want to give anyone the impression that this SuperAIO was designed to be used to upgrade TO win7.  The recommended setup for all operating systems is a clean install on a fresh partition/drive using boot setup.

murphy, thanks mate,
 I wonder if there is a good working crack for Windows XP. Some older computer still work better with XP. For newer versions of Win, there are Vistaloader, Daz loader, KMSpico...but for XP nothing.
I tried some 5-7 activators, non of them work properly. Ex, ANTIWPA activates, then almost all antimalware's recognize it and delete it.
Those  already activated versions with a simple key, are deactivated after the key is blacklisted. 

The only XP that still works is by Goldfish. But it is too old and it has 150 updates, no sata and no drivers. So after installation you have to run for drivers.

I wonder if you could make a Win XP Pro same as Goldfish plus all Sata, video, sound, network...drivers, and udates. So that with one shot installation is complete. No matter the size 3-4 Gig is ok too.

appreciate in advance

karated, back in the day they used client-side verification and you could simply copy over the legitcheckcontrol.dll(sp?) supremophantom famously cracked 1.0.40.0, but I think they've moved to more sophisticated whitelisting. I could be wrong. I only took a brief glance at it.

Anyhow, I had a family member with an old xp laptop that was pretty slow. I upgraded them to win7pro 32bit without problems. Did not seem slow. Ran about as fast as it did with xp. You might try something like that.
